intro: Elleanthus killipii, commonly known as the Killip's elleanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss, Elleanthus killipii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
